p: For the convenience of describing each atom, these function groups have been labeled, shown in Figure 1b. O 3 is the oxygen atom of epoxy in the center of NGO and O 4 is the oxygen atom of epoxy in the edge. O 5 and O 6 are oxygen atoms of hydroxyl in the edge and center of NGO respectively. The results in Table 1 show that the epoxy and hydroxyl groups on the edge are more vulnerable to electrophilic attacks than the groups on the surface.
